column1: Kinel (Russian: Кинель) is a city in Samara Oblast
column3: located on the Bolshoy Kinel River near its confluence with the Samara River
column4: 41 kilometers (25 mi) east of Samara. Population: 34

column2: during the construction of the Samara–Orenburg railroad
column3: the railway station of Kinel was built nearby. The station became a junction by 1888. In 1944

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Kinel serves as the administrative center of Kinelsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column6: incorporated separately as the city of federal subject significance of Kinel—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column7: the town of oblast significance of Kinel is incorporated as Kinel Urban Okrug.
